lines.line: Veliaf? What are you doing here?
Well met friend. I'm here on an investigation. There's something strange going on in this town, and I suspect the vampyres are involved.
Anything I can help with?
Not at the moment. Keep checking in though, I may have need of you soon.
Well an extra pair of hands is always beneficial. If you have the time of course?
Actually, I'm a bit busy right now. Maybe later.
Very well, friend. Myreque prevail.
Of course. What do you need?
This town has recently become home to an illness known as the Sleeper Plague. It's a nasty affliction. Those infected fall into a deep sleep, never to wake.

Now, Morytania is no stranger to odd afflictions. However, I've been doing some digging. Apparently, this isn't the first time this illness has beset Slepe. In fact, they say it's how the town was named.
And now the illness is back. You said you suspect the vampyres are involved?
I do. The first victim of the new Sleeper Plague was none other than Lady Crombwick. She rules over this town from Crombwick Manor, along with her husband.
He's not been seen since she fell ill, and their manor has been locked down.
Here's the interesting part though. Vampyres have been seen around the manor. Apparently they showed up around the time when the Sleeper Plague returned.
I see where this is going. You think the vampyres are the reason the plague is back.
I do. The question is, why?
I guess that's for us to work out. Where do we start?
We'll split up. I'm going to try and learn more about these vampyres at the manor. While I do that, I want you to try and find the source of the illness.
They're looking after the victims in this church here. I'd recommend you make that your starting point.
Sounds like a plan. Good luck.
And to you. Myreque prevail.
How have things been for you recently?
We haven't been doing too bad. Even out in Mort Myre, the impact of Ranis' death can be seen.
People have a little bit more hope now, and it has become easier for us to gather support.
That's good to know.
Of course, there are downsides. The vampyres are hunting us with ever greater determination. But this is the life we chose.
What do you know about this place?
Slepe? It's wretched. The people of this town follow the teachings of Zamorak. Some are no better than the vampyres themselves.
Do they get on with the vampyres?
As well as any humans can. All settlements in Morytania must pay the vampyres in blood tithes, but the people of Slepe do so willingly.
They see the vampyres as fellow servants of Zamorak. Of course, the vampyres only really serve themselves.
So why do these people follow Zamorak?
Apparently this place was founded by a group called the Sisterhood, former healers of Saradomin that turned to Zamorak.
Their order still exists to this day. You'll probably see a few of them around the town.
Can you tell me any more about the Sleeper Plague?
What I told you is pretty much what I know. The illness causes people to fall to sleep, never to wake again.
There's a rumour that the infected are also granted immortality, though I don't know if there's any truth in this.
To be honest, immortality doesn't seem very useful if you're unable to wake up.
Indeed. If history is to be believed, this is the second time the Sleeper Plague has hit Slepe. The first occurrence was many years ago and is supposedly what gave the town its name.
That's all I know. That said, I suspect you might be able to learn more if you do some digging around town.
I'd better get going.
Very well friend. Myreque prevail.
What am I meant to be doing?
You need to try and find the source of the Sleeper Plague. I'd start in the church. That's where they're looking after the victims.
Sounds like a plan.
You don't look too happy?
You're not wrong about that. It's my travelling companion, Hanchen. They say he's the latest victim of the Sleeper Plague.
Do you know how he fell ill?
I've no idea. We'd just been to the pub for a quick drink. On our way back, he started to act all odd, then he just collapsed.
Pub?
Yes. The Rat & Bat just south east of here. I'm not a drinker myself but Hanchen's always loved a good tipple.
Wait... you mean to say you weren't drinking?
No, I never drink. Hanchen on the other hand was loving those Bloody Bracers.
I see. Thanks for the information.
Like I said, I've no idea. We'd just been to the pub when it happened. Hanchen's always loved a good drink.
Well met friend. How goes the investigation?
Apparently the latest victim of the Sleeper Plague was at the pub shortly before falling ill.
Interesting. Might be worth a look.
Agreed. I'll see if I can discover anything.
What ales are you serving?
We serve Crombwick's finest Bloody Bracer, that is all.
Sounds rough, how much?
99 of your finest coins.
Where do you get your Bloody Bracers from?
It's an old recipe of the Crombwick family.
Okay. But the actual Bloody Bracers you sell, where do they come from?
Who's asking?
Well... me of course.
Yes, but what I mean is, why do you want to know?
Does it matter?
My supplier is a private individual. He doesn't like others meddling in his affairs. So yes, it does matter.
I represent... health?
Health? What are you on about?
Err... Health and safety of course, here on a routine inspection.
Part of my work requires me to inspect the source of your Bloody Bracers. I was hoping you'd put me in touch with your supplier.
I don't know what you're on about. There're no routine inspections here. Now clear off, I have customers to serve!
Well I might just have a look around anyway.
You don't give up do you. I'm not telling you anything so clear off.
Hmmm. Looks like Carl is pretty much out of Bloody Bracer. He'll need to collect more from his supplier soon.
Huh. Looks like we're all out of Bloody Bracer again.
Alright then Carl. Let's see what you're hiding...
The dungeon Carl? What are you hiding down there?
Carl? What do you want?
Kroy. We've run out of Bloody Bracer again.
Did you really need to come here to tell me that?
There's something else as well. Someone's been poking around, asking about Bloody Bracer.
Who?
I don't know. They don't look to be from around here.
So someone's been snooping around asking questions, and you decided to come here? What if they followed you?
I... I thought you'd want to know.
You're a fool Carl. If you're not careful, you'll jeopardise everything.
Hey! I don't need to help you!
No, you don't. Your predecessor didn't want to help us. Perhaps you remember what came of him?
Go back to your pub Carl. I'll have more Bloody Bracer sent over soon. In the meantime, try to be a bit smarter.
Fine.
Alright then, Damien. What is it that you're so keen to show me?
Vanstrom, I'd like you to meet Kroy.
Greetings, my lord.
Don't tell me you had me come all the way down here for this? Look at the wretched thing, Damien. It's barely even a proper juvenile.
Well just hang on there, Vanstrom. Kroy may not look like much, but I've never met a vampyre with a better knowledge of herblore.
Kroy, tell him what you found.
Of course, my lord.
It was hidden deep within the sanctuary here. A recipe, for an elixir.
An elixir?
Yes! The ones that built the place, the Sisterhood, they called it the Elixir of Everlasting.
And just what is this Elixir of Everlasting?
Those who drink it find their lives heavily extended, but at a cost. They are put into a deep sleep, never to wake.
So the Sleeper Plague? That was your doing?
Indeed. Using the recipe, Kroy was easily able to recreate the elixir. After a quick test on Lady Crombwick, we started giving it to the citizens.
We hide it in their beer, Bloody Bracer. They've no idea what it's really doing to them!
And while they sleep, we tithe them. The sleepers only need a fraction of the blood a normal human needs, so we can take more than ever before!
And tell me, Damien, who gave you permission to do this?
The nobles of Darkmeyer make their demands Vanstrom. Someone has to meet them.
That someone is not you. I am in charge of blood tithing. I alone decide how it is to be carried out.
The nobles are restless. They are tired of inaction. I saw an opportunity and I took it. Lord Drakan should thank me.
I don't doubt the ingenuity of your plan. This elixir could have great potential. The thing I doubt is your recklessness. This Sleeper Plague has attracted attention. The wrong kind of attention.
The Myreque? Don't tell me you're scared of that lot, Vanstrom? I thought you were made of stronger stuff.
I do not fear the Myreque. I have no need to. They have no way of touching me.
But you on the other hand, you should be very afraid. Out here alone, without the support of the Drakan household. You're a prime target. And if what I hear is true, they're right on your doorstep.
What's that supposed to mean?
The Myreque are already here in Slepe, Damien. The one that killed Ranis Drakan is among them. Your overconfidence has begun your downfall.
Well you'll have to do something. You'll need to send us some support.
I will do no such thing. You defied Lord Drakan when you came out here. The consequences of your actions are your own to deal with.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I will be on my way. There are things in Darkmeyer that require my attention.
How much did you hear, human?
Enough.
I see. Then you know that I can't let you leave this place alive.
Tempting offer. Death isn't on my to-do list today though, so I'll have to decline.
A joker? Your arrogance will be your end, human.
We'll see.
Yes... We shall...
Well that's him dealt with. I should destroy his lab as well. Don't want anyone else continuing his work.
There. That should stop anyone from continuing Kroy's work. I should inform Veliaf.
Well met friend. Anything to report?
You were right about the vampyres. I did some digging and discovered that they are indeed the cause of the Sleeper Plague.
A vampyre in the dungeon called Kroy was making infected Bloody Bracers. The local barkeep was then selling them to the townspeople.
I put a stop to that though. I killed Kroy and destroyed his lab. The barkeep has no supply now.
Excellent work friend. This should stop any new cases of the illness.
There's something else, too. While I was spying on Kroy, I saw Vanstrom Klause with another vampyre called Damien. It sounded like Damien was Kroy's boss.
The vampyre you speak of is a noble called Damien Leucurte. He's a known quantity to us. My investigations at the manor also involved the two of them, but let's hear the rest of your findings first.
Well, in their conversations, it was revealed why they caused the new Sleeper Plague. Apparently, they did it to make it easier to take blood tithes.
But here's the interesting thing. Vanstrom didn't seem very happy with this. It sounded like Damien was doing it without his permission.
This is all very interesting. The citizens of this town are Zamorakians and willingly give their blood to the vampyres. Why would Damien need the Sleeper Plague?
He talked about increased demand from the nobles of Darkmeyer. Perhaps they have need for more blood than normal?
That would make sense. I've heard rumours that the vampyre population has grown such that demand for blood now exceeds supply. Damien may be looking for ways to satisfy this demand.
Even so, this seems extreme. And to go behind Vanstrom's back as well? Maybe their overcrowding issues are bigger than we first realised.
Maybe. So, what's our next move?
I have an idea about that, although my information is not quite as exciting as yours I'm afraid.
While I was investigating the manor, I discovered that it has indeed been taken over by vampyres. Our friend Damien seems to be the leader of this group.
During my time there, I also managed to spy on Vanstrom and Damien. I only heard a small part of their conversation, but Vanstrom didn't seem very happy, which matches up with what you heard.
At one point, Vanstrom insulted Damien for his recklessness and accused him of demanding too much from the werewolves. Sounds like they've also been gathering extra blood without permission.
That sounds familiar. I suspect it was werewolves who attacked me that time at Paterdomus.
Yes, that encounter also sprung into my mind. It sounds like things are even worse now.
So you want to investigate the werewolves?
I do indeed. Something is going on in Darkmeyer that's causing this increased demand. If there's unrest in the city, we might be able to use it to our advantage.
What about Slepe? Should we not deal with Damien as well?
Not yet. Your actions will have drawn attention to us. We cannot stay here. It sounds like Damien can do little without Kroy, so I doubt he'll be much trouble anyway.
Besides, we've already done too much for these Zamorakians. There are others more deserving of our time.
But aren't we meant to help people?
That's a complicated question friend. But yes, of course we are meant to help people.
Then why are we letting Damien get away with this? Carl as well?
Damien and Carl are small fish in a very big pond. Dealing with them might help the people here, but it will mean nothing to the rest of Morytania.
If we want to help as many people as possible, we need to think bigger than that. The Drakan family, they are the real targets.
I suppose. It just seems harsh to leave these people in the hands of a vampyre like Damien.
We've already done a lot to help here. Besides, Damien will get what's coming to him in the end, I'm sure of that.
You're sure this isn't just because they're Zamorakian?
Zamorakians are evil my friend, it does not shame me to say it. But no, if this were a Saradominist town, my actions would be the same.
Okay, fair enough.
You have a good heart my friend. I have a lot of respect for that. I assure you that if we keep on our current path, we will bring freedom to all of Morytania.
Thank you, Veliaf. So, what's our next move?
Meet me at Paterdomus friend. We will check in with Drezel and Ivan, before continuing our investigation.
Okay, I'll meet you there.
Be careful out there. Myreque prevail.
Fair enough, so what now?
Well met friend. Good to see you made it in one piece.
Indeed, I hear Morytania becomes more dangerous by the day.
You can say that again. Good to see you Drezel. Has Veliaf already filled you in?
Not yet, I thought it best to wait for you.
But you're here now, so let's get started.
Well Drezel, the reason we are here is due to an investigation we've been conducting in Slepe.
Ah. I hear it's a nasty place, full of Zamorakian filth. Suffering from some sort of outbreak as well, I've been told.
Yes, the Sleeper Plague. It turns out, however, that the vampyres are responsible.
Seems that one of their nobles, Damien Leucurte, has been looking for ways to increase blood output. Interestingly, he's been doing it without consent from the Drakan family.
That's right. Vanstrom doesn't seem to be very happy about it.
Interesting. It's odd you should come to report this, because we've also experienced some strange happenings around here.
Hmm. Do these strange happenings have anything to do with werewolves, by any chance?
They do.
I knew it. What's been going on?
Well, after here was ambushed outside the temple a while back, Ivan and I decided to keep a closer eye on things.
For a time, nothing unusual happened. The reports of trouble in the area died down, and everything seemed normal.
Perhaps their encounter with you scared them off,.
Maybe. But if so, it was only for a time. A few weeks ago, the reports of people going missing in the area started again. And they're much worse this time.
How so?
Entire groups have been going missing. Not just miners and travellers either. Even some of the king's mercenaries have vanished.
Did you send word to the king?
We did. His adviser though, Aeonisig, encouraged him to refrain from military action.
Typical. This is why I hate politics.
Has anyone seen who's been doing this? Is it definitely werewolves?
We believe so. Ivan has been keeping a close watch. The disappearances have mostly taken place further up the pass, however, so it's taken a while for him to find any leads.
But he has found one?
Yes, last night. He overheard a hooded figure mention a meeting in the Haunted Woods, directly south of Fenkenstrain's Castle, that is apparently set for today.
Perfect. Sounds like that's where we should head next then.
On the topic of Ivan, where is he Drezel?
Ah... Well that's just the thing. He went to spy on the meeting.
What? You just let him go? He's just a boy!
He's a grown man, Veliaf! One far smarter than either you or I. If he wants to do something, he will do it. I can't stop him!
You should have sent word to us! This is for us to deal with, not him!
There wasn't time. He only found out about the meeting last night!
Ivan is still a member of the Myreque, isn't he? Surely he can look after himself.
That's not the point! He needs to be kept safe!
I don't understand. Why is Ivan so important?
Ivan... Well, Ivan is special. He is the last in his bloodline.
And what bloodline is that?
Ivan is the last living descendant of Ivandis Seergaze himself. Once I am gone, he will be the only remaining descendant of the Seven Priestly Warriors.
Are you becoming forgetful, ? The Seven Priestly Warriors were the ones who originally blessed the River Salve.
Without their sacrifice, Drakan and his kin would have long since taken over Misthalin.
Ah yes, I remember. So, this is why you want to keep Ivan safe, Veliaf?
I see. So that's why you want to keep him safe, Veliaf?
It's not just about that. There's also the promise I made. Before his mother died, I swore to her on my life that I would shield Ivan from any harm.
Though I nearly failed her when Vanstrom killed Sani and Harold.
Veliaf, my friend, you and I will not be around to protect Ivan forever. We have guided him to this point, but maybe it's time for him to start looking after himself.
And what of his learnings here? You would have him abandon them?
I have taught Ivan everything I know. There is nothing more he can gain from me.
Forgive me, but this can be resolved later. For now, we need to find Ivan and see what this meeting is about.
Yes, you're absolutely right, friend. Forgive us. Directly south of Fenkenstrain's Castle. Is that right Drezel?
That's right. In the Haunted Woods.
Very well. Meet me there,. Let's see if we can find out what's going on.
Oh, and, I would appreciate it if you could avoid mentioning the stuff about Ivandis Seergaze to Ivan. One day he will have to bear that burden. But for now, he has enough weight on his shoulders.
I understand.
Good luck to you both. Saradomin be with you.
Meet me in the Haunted Woods, just south of Fenkenstrain's Castle. We will hopefully find Ivan there.
Okay, I'll see you there.
You should head for the Haunted Woods, friend. With luck, you'll find Ivan just south of Fenkenstrain's Castle.
Could you tell me more about the Seven Priestly Warriors?
Well at this point you should be no stranger to their tale, though I understand the desire for a recap.
During the Fourth Age, the vampyre forces of Lowerniel Drakan attempted to invade Misthalin. They would have succeeded, were it not for the Seven Priestly Warriors.
The warriors were the ones to bless the River Salve and build this temple, ensuring that Misthalin would be forever safe from the evils of Morytania.
Sadly, all seven of them fell in the final battle against Drakan. They are now buried here, in this very mausoleum.
I don't know if that's completely true.
You talk of the suggestion that Ivandis Seergaze isn't actually buried with the others, don't you? That isn't a conversation I wish to have.
Fair enough. Anything else you can tell me about the Warriors?
Not really. You might learn more in the library below, but I'd be cautious of believing every word in those books.
Okay. Thanks Drezel.
I'm on it.
! So good to see you. What brings you out here?
Hello there, Ivan. Believe it or not, I'm actually here for you.
For me? I'm guessing Drezel sent you?
That's right. He told us of your discovery about the werewolves. We came to lend a hand.
We? Is Veliaf with you?
Yes. We've been investigating something together. We suspect it may be connected to this situation with the werewolves. I imagine he'll be here shortly.
Veliaf!
Ivan. It's good to see you safe.
And you. says you're here about the werewolves.
Indeed. But Ivan, you shouldn't be out here. It's not safe for you. Head back to the temple, let and I take it from here.
Don't worry, Veliaf. I can look after myself.
Ivan...
Wait! Look!
You're late.
Well look who it is. Damien Leucurte! I thought you didn't like to associate with our lot.
Scared of getting mud on his pretty clothes, I bet.
Mind your tongue, dog, or I'll have you put in a collar.
Your threats mean nothing out here Damien. There're no Drakans around to protect you.
Not that Drakan protection means much these days anyway. His own brother killed by a human. How does he respond? He stays hiding in his fancy castle.
Ha! You think this one would get Drakan protection even if he were about? I hear Vanstrom has found out about this little side venture. Little Damien has been a very naughty boy.
Enough of this! What do you have for me?
A nice family of three, out for a little picnic a bit too close to the Salve.
Please... don't hurt us. We'll do anything!
Shut up!
Three? Is that all?
Well if you want more, you're welcome to cross the Salve yourself and get them.
There's been a setback with our operations in Slepe. We need you to make up the shortfall. Next time, bring more.
You assume there's going to be a next time. I bet you don't last another week now that the Myreque are running around with vampyre-killing weapons.
A week? He won't even last another day at the rate he's going!
I tire of your arrogance. We're done here.
Yes, we are. See you around Damien.
Or not.
So it's as we suspected. The werewolves have been taking people from across the Salve.
But they've been doing so without permission, just like in Slepe.
This doesn't give us anything more to go on though. We have our suspicions, but we still don't know for sure why they are doing this.
Should we follow them? Maybe we'll learn more if we do. We might also get a chance to save that poor family.
No, it's too risky. Last thing we need is you getting captured, Ivan.
Hang on... Do you two hear something?
Go on then! Finish it!
Oh Veliaf my dear, If I'd wanted you dead I'd have done it a long time ago.
You're not here to kill us?
No... I'm here to talk...
So... Let's talk.
I take it you know who I am?
You're Vanescula Drakan, sister to Lowerniel Drakan.
And formally, sister to Ranis Drakan, before here came along.
Ah yes, the great vampyre slayer. I would thank you, were it not for the fact that his funeral was such a dull affair.
Wait... You wanted him dead?
There was no love between Ranis and I. You did us a favour when you got rid of him.
That's a shame. Maybe I shouldn't have bothered.
Oh on the contrary, the death of Ranis was just what we needed.
Save your words. You didn't come to thank us for Ranis. Why are you here?
Ah, and there I was thinking we were starting to become friends. Fine. I'm here to make you an offer. A once in a lifetime offer.
Which is?
You've already killed one of my brothers. Now I offer you the chance to kill the other.
Alone, you have no hope of ever getting close to Lowerniel. Now, I on the otherhand, can get you right into his chambers at Castle Drakan.
And why would you want that?
I have my reasons.
Care to share them?
I will, but not here.
Where then?
To the south east of Meiyerditch, there's an old graveyard. The Icyene Graveyard, we call it. Gather the Myreque, every member, and meet me there. That is where I will present my proposal.
Every member of the Myreque? Do you take us for fools? You're trying to lure us all there to wipe us out.
As I said to you earlier, Veliaf, if I wanted you dead I'd have done it long ago.
You're bluffing!
Am I? So if I were to head to the Burgh de Rott inn and go down into the basement, what would I find?
You...
If I were to give the order, I could have the heads of every member of the Myreque mounted above the gates of Castle Drakan before the day is out.
Don't be so sure. There's more of us than you think.
Is there now? Do you refer to the elusive Calsidiu, the apparent leader of the Myreque?
A lie, I'm afraid. I know exactly how many of you there are. And that number isn't as big as you'd like to pretend.
A lie? Veliaf...
You've made your point Vanescula. How do we get to this graveyard?
A boat will be your easiest way I imagine. I'll let you worry about the details.
Incidentally, should you fail to attend...
You'll mount our heads above the gates of Castle Drakan. Yeah, we get it.
Excellent, glad we understand one another. I will await you at the graveyard.
This isn't good.
Veliaf... You lied about Calsidiu and the other Myreque?
Yes. But it was with good intention, Ivan. To believe there were more of us out there... It inspired hope in our ranks, and fear in our enemies.
A false hope.
Better than none at all. Ivan, I have made some tough choices over my years, but every one of them was for the good of Morytania.
Okay... I understand. I don't like it, but I understand.
I don't like it either. Later, we will sit down and properly discuss this. However, at the moment I fear we have more pressing matters.
Vanescula. What do we do?
Go back to Paterdomus, Ivan. and I will handle it.
But you heard what she said. She asked for all the Myreque. Veliaf, I'm one of the Myreque, I have to come with you.
Come with us? What makes you think we're even going? What makes you think we have any intention of listening to that witch?
We don't have a choice, Veliaf, you know that. If we don't go, she'll kill us all.
I fear Ivan is right. It doesn't seem like Vanescula has given us any other options.
Exactly. The decision has already been made for us, so I see little point in debating it. We're going. All of us.
Dammit Ivan! I'm trying to keep you safe!
You can't keep me safe, Veliaf. No one can. While Lowerniel Drakan lives, none of us will ever be safe.
We have to do this. It's the only choice we have.
Fine. But don't expect me to even pretend to be happy about this! Breaking bread with a vampyre! What have we come to?
We're not breaking bread with her. We're going to see what she has to offer. If she tries anything, here can deal with her, just like he did to her brother.
It would be my pleasure. What's our plan?
I will travel down to Burgh de Rott and inform Radigad and Polmafi of this plight we find ourselves in. I'll also have word sent to Safalaan and the others in Meiyerditch.
, I would appreciate it if you could escort Ivan down to Burgh de Rott.
I need to collect some things from Paterdomus first. I'll update Drezel while I'm there. Once I'm done, I'll meet you outside the temple, on the Canifis side.
Sounds good to me.
I will see you both at the boathouse in Burgh de Rott. We can use the boat there to get to this graveyard. Good luck.
Hey there. I think I'm all ready to depart when you are.
What's our plan?
We need to travel through Mort Myre Swamp to Burgh de Rott. We may encounter all kinds of evil on our way, so you'd probably best prepare to fight.
Are you ready to go to Burgh de Rott?
I'm ready.
Then let us depart.
I need to prepare first.
Okay, I'll be here once you're ready.
Hey.
How are you doing?
I'm good. The swamps haven't beaten me yet.
How are things between you and Veliaf?
Oh don't be worrying about that. Veliaf and I butt heads all the time. It's harmless, though. He's like a father to me.
He seems to worry a lot about you.
He thinks I'd be safer back with Drezel. I can't stay hidden away forever though. Drezel's teachings were valuable, but I can ultimately do more good out here.
And what of the Calsidiu stuff?
Hmm. I still need to think on that. Ask me again later.
What do you think of this Vanescula business?
It's dangerous, but we don't have any choice. Besides, we're no strangers to danger.
Who knows, maybe this will even work out for us.
And if it doesn't?
Keep that flail of yours nearby.
Let's get going.
Well that's torn it... Looks like we can't get over this bog. We'll have to go back to Paterdomus.
Oh, I'm sure we can find a way through!
That's amazing! I'll have to do the same.
That was great! But we really should be heading off now.
Rotten luck! The bridge is out. Do you think there's a way over?
I reckon we can come up with something.
And what do we have here? Looks like some fresh Myreque meat!
Hang on... That's the Slayer! The one that killed Ranis Drakan!
Uh oh...
Another successful journey. Thanks,.
I'll meet you down at the boathouse. I imagine Veliaf is there already.
Well, here we are. Likely going to our doom.
At least we go together.
Touching, but ultimately meaningless.
Ever the optimist, aren't you Veliaf?
Is everything ready?
Radigad has scouted out the graveyard. It's empty, for now. Vanescula's probably waiting for all of us to arrive before she makes her move.
What of Safalaan and the others?
Polmafi managed to get in contact with them. They will meet us there.
I guess we'd better get going then.
Indeed. No point delaying the inevitable. Hop in the boat once you're ready, friend. We're right behind you.
Hop in the boat once you're ready, friend. We're right behind you.
Hey. You should get into the boat if you're ready to go.
Good to see you,.
And you, Kael.
You'd best talk to Veliaf and Safalaan. They are the big bosses after all.
I'll go speak to them.
Well met friend.
Radigad. Good to see you.
I hope you came well armed my friend. These are dangerous times.
When are they not?
True. It looks like Veliaf and Safalaan are waiting for you. We will talk more later.
Hey. Looks like Veliaf and Safalaan want to speak to you. Let's talk after.
Okay. See you soon.
Ah,. Glad to have you with us. Myreque prevail.
Good to see you Vertida. How are things?
To be honest, I don't know. Ask me again if we're still alive after this meeting.
Fair enough. Talk later.
Hello there. Have you spoken to Veliaf and Safalaan?
Not yet.
Ah, probably best that you do. That vampyre could arrive at any moment.
Veliaf! It has been far too long my friend.
Good to see you, Safalaan. Though I wish it were under better circumstances.
Indeed. And, good to see you as well. Myreque prevail.
Myreque prevail, Safalaan. How are things in Meiyerditch?
As dark as ever, my friend. The vyrewatch have doubled their efforts to find us since the death of Ranis and the citizens are being tithed more than ever before.
That said, it does feel like there is now a glimmer of hope where previously there was only darkness. While more ferocious, the vampyres also seem a bit more cautious now.
They know we can kill them. They finally know what fear feels like.
We're also seeing greater support from the people than ever before. Whereas once they'd only speak of the Myreque in whispers, now they speak of us loudly and with pride.
Anyway, let's focus on the matter at hand. I must say Veliaf, over the years I've come to expect the unexpected, but your message was something else altogether.
I mean, Vanescula Drakan herself! We find ourselves in very strange times.
Strange, and also dangerous. I do not like any aspect of this.
Well I won't pretend this isn't risky. But I have faith in, here. The first human to kill a vyre, and quite the vyre it was. Vanescula would be unwise to try anything.
Speaking of, about that other matter I mentioned in my message...
Ah, of course., after due consideration by Veliaf and I, we would like to promote you to the rank of lieutenant in the Myreque. Congratulations!
You've done well, friend. I realise it doesn't mean much, but we wanted to thank you in some way for all of your work so far.
Thank you. It's a great honour.
I wish we had time to celebrate, but time is in short supply these days. I imagine Vanescula will be here very soon. Are we ready?
As ready as we'll ever be. Let's do this.
Well Vanescula, here we are. All the Myreque, just like you wanted.
Your move.
I'm impressed Veliaf. I did fear you'd go and do something silly.
Skip the small talk. Why are we here?
Fine. Conversing with you is a chore, anyway.
The reason I have gathered you all here is because I have an offer for you.
Now I won't deny, you've not done a bad job. Killing Ranis was no small achievement, but you managed it all the same.
Unfortunately for you, you're still no closer to the true prize.
Lowerniel Drakan.
Indeed. That is why I have come to you. Only with my help will you have any hope of killing my brother.
And what do you gain from this?
Long ago, the land of Morytania was known as Hallowvale and it was ruled over by a race of Saradominists called the icyene.
But then your brother came along.
Correct. Hallowvale was taken over by my kind, and Lowerniel became ruler of the newly named Morytania.
And you know what? It was the worst thing that ever happened to us.
My brother was a great conqueror, make no mistake. But he is a poor ruler. And now, thanks to him, our society is collapsing.
Collapsing how?
I know you've already been investigating Damien Leucurte and his not so secret arrangement with some of Darkmeyer's nobles.
Tell me, have you worked out why this arrangement exists?
We could have a good guess.
Well I can give you better than guesses. Allow me to offer some clarity.
Every day that goes by, the number of humans in Morytania decreases. Yet while this happens, our population continues to grow. Unsurprisingly, we no longer have enough blood to go around.
Yeah, yeah. We've suspected as much for a long time. Why is this relevant?

It's relevant because while all of this happens, our great leader remains absent. Lowerniel never liked to show his face, but these days it's as if he doesn't even exist. He spends months in his chambers, refusing to see anyone.
So you wish to take his place. What makes you think we'll help you with that?
There was once a time where humans and vampyres lived together in a great empire. Under my rule, I would see us return to that way of life.
Morytania would become a land of peace and prosperity, with humans and vampyres living side by side.
Or we could just kill both you and your brother and take back Morytania for humanity!
Ha! You could try. Even if you were to succeed though, which isn't likely, one of the other vampyre lords or ladies would just take over instead.
No. If you want to save your people, my way is the only way.
Why do you need us though? Why not just kill your brother yourself?
I could, but even today there are many in Darkmeyer who still blindly believe in Lowerniel. It will be much easier for me to take his place if I am not responsible for his demise.
You'd have us become your scapegoats.
Is that such a bad thing? Your people would consider you heroes. You'd be the ones to finally kill Lowerniel Drakan.
How do we know you won't just kill us once this is done?
You don't. But Castle Drakan is impenetrable. You'll never get inside on your own, and Lowerniel clearly has no intention of coming out. This is your only option.
Oh, it's probably also worth mentioning that I can't afford any loose ends. If you decline, I would expect you to leave Morytania immediately.
To stay would have dire consequences for your life expectancy.
Say we accept your offer. How do you propose to get us into the castle?
Ah yes, the plan itself. You will pose as my prisoners and I shall escort you to Castle Drakan. Your capture is something that even Lowerniel will be unable to ignore.
And once inside, we kill him.
Exactly. A nice and simple plan.
Too simple, if you ask me.
Never happy are you Veliaf?
Of course I'm not happy. You expect us to just hop into bed with you? You are the enemy! You always have been, and you always will be! We will have no part in this.
Come now, don't be so hasty. You should at least think things over. While you do, I would appreciate a private chat with Safalaan.
Me?
Yes, you. Join me by the large mausoleum at the back of the graveyard. There is something we need to discuss.
What makes you think we're just going to let you walk off with him?
This is growing boringly repetitive, Veliaf. For the last time, if I wanted any of you dead, I'd have done it by now.
It's alright Veliaf. I will go.
Hmm. Well has to go with you. I want him there in case Vanescula here tries anything.
Very well. Safalaan, if you'll please join me.
Safalaan Hallow. Interesting name, isn't it?
What of it?
The name 'Hallow'. Do you know where it comes from?
It's common in these parts. They say it was the name of the old Saradominist rulers.
Spot on. You know your history. The family of icyene that ruled over Hallowvale were the Hallow family. And so of course, the name of the region is no coincidence.
I'm surprised your brother didn't have it renamed 'Drakanvale'.
Good name, but not really his style I'm afraid.
What's your game, Vanescula? Why do you care about my name?
Do you not find it odd that you share a name with the former royal family?
No, I don't. Like I say, around here the name is pretty ordinary.
Ah, but you are far from ordinary, aren't you Safalaan? Tell me, how much do you remember of your childhood?
Nothing. I remember nothing of my childhood. You can thank your friend Vanstrom for that. He always wanted me dead, even back before the Myreque were a thing. One day he nearly succeeded.
But your powers stopped him?
You know about Safalaan's powers?
I know many things about Safalaan. It's why we are here, in fact. But please, go on.
It's why we're here? What do you mean? What is all this?
Finish your story. I promise that everything will be made clear.
Fine, but it's starting to seem like you already know everything anyway.
You're right about my powers. I was able to use them to drive Vanstrom away. It came at a cost though.
I remember nothing of the event, nor of anything that happened in my life before it. The only thing I remembered was my name.
There, story told. Now, tell me, why are we having this conversation?
This graveyard is no normal graveyard. It was once the private graveyard of the Hallow family. Every member of the royal family was buried here.
When she was still in power, the ruler of Hallowvale, Queen Efaritay Hallow, had this mausoleum built. It was constructed to one day house her and her human husband, King Ascertes Hallow.
Inside, I believe you will find the truth that you've spent your whole life searching for.
Stop with these games! If you know something, tell me!
Would you actually believe me if I did? To you, my words are just that, words. Inside this mausoleum lies something far more reliable, proof.
The door is locked.
Well noted. We'll need to unlock it.
I bet I can get it open.
Wonderful. It's an interesting lock. The icyene always were devious. From what I can tell, you'll need to ensure that the total value of each row and column matches the number at the end.
Now, off you go.
Any luck with the lock, ?
Try to hurry. I don't like these games that Vanescula is playing.
You need to get this door open. From what I can tell, you'll need to ensure that the total value of each row and column on the lock matches the number at the end.
Keep an eye on Safalaan,. I don't like leaving him alone with that vampyre.
Will do.
Hey. You need to be over with Safalaan and Vanescula. We'll talk later.
Best we don't talk right now,. You need to be watching Safalaan and Vanescula and I don't want to distract you.
Shouldn't you be with Safalaan?
Oh yes, I'd better go to him.
Now's not the time for chat,. You're meant to be watching Safalaan and Vanescula.
You should be keeping an eye on Safalaan and Vanescula. We will talk later.
Well?
There's a plaque on the coffin.
What does it say?
It reads:
'Here lies Larina Hallow. Beloved daughter of Efaritay and Ascertes Hallow and...'
And?
My god...
'...and faithful sister of Safalaan Hallow.'
I... I don't...
No! It can't be true! It can't be!
I'm sorry Safalaan, but it is true. You are the half- human, half-icyene son of Queen Efaritay Hallow.
A sister... I had a sister. And my powers?
The powers of an icyene, yes.
But... I don't understand...
I realise it's a lot to take in.
No. What I mean is, you said that this tomb was built for Efaritay and Ascertes, for my mother and father. But they're not here.
Where are they Vanescula?
Safalaan I...
No! No more games! I know why you've done this. You don't care for me. You're just trying to manipulate me!
Well fine, it worked. If you want my support in killing your brother, you will have it. But you must tell me, where are my parents?
The war for this land was long and bloody. We were winning, but with heavy losses. Lowerniel didn't mind. He was a hunter and a warrior. In his eyes, there was no death more noble than one in battle.
Many didn't share that view though, and wanted the war to be over. Ranis was one of them. He managed to infiltrate Efaritay's castle. Once inside, he captured your father, Ascertes.
Efaritay surrendered that same day. She walked into Lowerniel's camp, alone, and willingly handed herself in. I guess she had hoped that Lowerniel would free your father in exchange for her.
But he didn't, did he?
No. After that, I'm afraid I don't know what happened to your mother. No one ever saw her again. Only Lowerniel himself knows her fate.
And my father?
Like I said, we suffered heavy losses in the war. We needed a way to quickly restore our numbers. Vampyrification was the answer. Your father was the first of many to go through the process.
You turned him into a vampyre? You monsters!
Lowerniel turned him into a vampyre, not I.
But you were there, by his side. Do you expect me to believe that you're not just like him?
I can't control what you believe, but I am not the enemy here.
What happened then? After you had your way with him, what became of my father?
He still lives to this day, under a different name of course.
What name? Tell me!
Vanstrom Klause.
No! You're lying! You said it yourself earlier, I have no reason to believe you!
Everything I have told you is the truth. Only you can decide if you want to believe it.
Safalaan...
My family...
Alright Vanescula, you win. If you want Lowerniel dead, you will have the support of the Myreque. I ask only one thing.
Which is?
When the time comes, I will be the one to kill him. He will pay for what he has done to me and my family.
So be it. You should inform the rest of your group.
, I need some time to think over what we have discovered here. Please, inform the others for me.
Of course.
Now, both of you leave. I need some time alone.
Yes?
I wanted to ask you something.
No. You need to tell your companions about Safalaan's decision. Now, get going.
Myreque prevail,.
Myreque prevail, Vertida.
I saw you head into that mausoleum with Safalaan and Vanescula. What's going on?
Turns out this graveyard is more than just a quiet meeting place. That mausoleum contained the truth behind Safalaan's heritage.
Truth? What do you mean?
Safalaan is the only living child of Efaritay Hallow, the former queen of Hallowvale.
By Saradomin!
Is he okay? That's quite the sudden discovery.
He wishes to be alone. In the meantime, he asked me to speak to everyone.
He's agreed to work with her, hasn't he?
How did you know?
I know what he's like. I've known Safalaan longer than anyone. When Vanstrom attacked him and he lost his memory, I was the one that found him.
Well, if Safalaan wants to work with Vanescula, then he has my support.
Oh. That was easy. I was expecting you to disagree with him.
I trust Safalaan. He's made some mistakes, sure. But he's a good leader and I know he won't have made this choice lightly. Tell him he has my support all the way on this.
Alright, thanks Vertida.
Have you spoken to the others about the plan?
I'm doing that now.
Well I'll let you get back to it then.
See you later.
Hello there. I hope Vanescula isn't causing trouble.
Not yet she isn't. In fact, Safalaan has decided he wants to work with her.
He does? Why?
She showed him the truth about his family. That seemed to convince him.
Oh dear. I fear she is trying to manipulate him.
So you don't agree with his decision?
Vanescula does not strike me as someone that fails to consider every detail of a plan. However, you must have spotted the clear holes in this scheme to kill her brother.
Like what?

Her plan detailed getting us in and killing her brother. But there was no mention of getting us out again. We'll have just killed the ruler of Morytania. To the vampyres, we'll be public enemy number one.
If you ask me, I reckon that Vanescula will kill us all as soon as her brother is out of the picture.
So you don't support the plan?
I'm afraid not. Killing Lowerniel Drakan is no victory at all if he just gets replaced with his sister. Especially if it results in our demise.
Fair enough. I'll see what the others think.
Hello there.
Hello. I was wondering if you'd changed your mind about working with Vanescula?
Well maybe it doesn't have to. Radigad has a plan of his own. He thinks that once her brother is dead, we should kill Vanescula as well.
An interesting proposal. Do you think we can do it?
If we can kill Lowerniel, we can kill her. He's meant to be the most powerful vampyre around.
A fair point. And I guess if we can't kill Lowerniel, what does it matter at that point. We'll all be dead.
A pleasant thought. So, are you still against the plan?
I still fear it's a trap. But perhaps our best move now is to spring that trap. You've convinced me. I will support Safalaan.
Great, thanks.
Hello there. Have you convinced the others to work with Vanescula?
I'm still working on it.
Well keep at it.
Hey. I've been pondering what Vanescula told us about Calsidiu.
And?
I understand why Veliaf lied at the time. We were on the brink of defeat. Without a bit of hope, we'd have probably never made it to this point.
But I don't think we need that false hope any more. Now, we have real hope. Ranis Drakan is dead! Ranis Drakan! He was Lowerniel Drakan's own brother!
If Ranis can die, so can the rest. Lowerniel's days are numbered.
So you're not angry at Veliaf?
No. He did what he believed was right. In the end, that's all any of us can do.
Well on that note, how do you feel about Vanescula's plan?
It's dangerous, but so what? We're the Myreque, danger is what we do. I say we go for it.
It seems you're not alone with that sentiment. Safalaan wishes to work with Vanescula.
You have my support. It's Veliaf you need to convince.
I guess I'd better talk to him then.
Hey. Any luck with Veliaf?
He can't say no forever. If everyone else is on board, he'll have to agree.
Let's hope so. Talk later Ivan.
. How goes it?
Safalaan has decided he wants to work with Vanescula.
Has he now? A good decision if you ask me.
You think so?
Oh yes. Here's how I see it. Vanescula is right, we can't kill her brother without her help.
I feel like there's a 'but' coming on.
But... once the deed is done, we don't have any further need of her. We kill her as well and Morytania is finally free of that wretched family.
You heard what she said. If we kill her another vampyre could just take her place.
Well of course she said that. She needs us to believe that we need her, otherwise her whole plan is done for.
Think about it. Lowerniel Drakan is supposedly the most powerful vampyre in existence. What vampyre would dare cross the humans that killed him?
You make a fair point. I take it you're happy to work with Vanescula then?
Of course! Let's rid Morytania of evil, once and for all!
I'm still working to convince the others to work with Vanescula.
You should let them know my plan. I bet that will convince some of them.
Good idea. Thanks Radigad.
And you, Kael. I wanted to talk to you about Vanescula's plan.
Appears risky to me, friend. Vampyres are the enemy and she is a vampyre.
We take risks every day though, don't we?
We do. But some we take because we have to, others because we choose to.
We took an unnecessary risk back in Meiyerditch with Serafina. Look how that turned out. Flaygian, Mekritus and Andiess. All dead because of that risk.
Were you close to them?
Flaygian and Mekritus? Not particularly. They were good men, and it was sad to lose them, but we were not close.
Now, Andiess on the other hand, he and I grew up together. Before Safalaan found us, he was all I had. But now he's gone and nothing I do will ever bring him back.
Do you blame Safalaan?
No. He could not have known what would happen. But that doesn't mean we should take more unnecessary risks.
This could be our only chance to kill Lowerniel Drakan. Surely that makes the risk necessary?
I want to believe that, I really do. I just don't know if I'm ready to lose any more friends.
I can't promise there won't be losses. But what of the losses we've already suffered? If we don't kill Lowerniel Drakan, surely they were all for nothing?
I... I guess you're right. Okay then, I'm in. Let's kill him, for Andiess, and for everyone else who's suffered because of him.
He'll regret the day he crossed the Myreque.
I'd better not disturb you. You need to tell the others about the plan.
Well met. Tell me, what's Vanescula up to with Safalaan?
Turns out Vanescula knows a lot about Safalaan. More than he knows about himself in fact.
What do you mean?
That mausoleum contained the truth about Safalaan's family. He is the only surviving child of Hallowvale's queen, Efaritay Hallow.
No! It can't be!
Are you sure this isn't a trick? It could be a trap set by Vanescula?
Possibly, though I don't think so. It all adds up. What else could explain his strange abilities?
Hmm. I guess it does fit.
That's not the only thing. Vanescula told us that Safalaan's father still lives, but as a vampyre. Vanstrom Klause.
Those monsters! How has Safalaan taken this?
As well as can be expected. However, he has decided it's best that we work with Vanescula.
What? This is a bad idea! She is a vampyre, we can't trust her.
So you won't work with her?
No. I'm sorry, but no. She's trying to manipulate Safalaan but I see through her lies. I can't support this.
I see.
Hello Veliaf. Have you thought any more about working with Vanescula?
There is no more thinking to do. The answer is still no.
You know, all the others have agreed to the plan. It's just you.
All of them? But why?
They all have their reasons. They all seem valid reasons to me.
But they must know that we can't trust Vanescula.
I think they know that. We do not necessarily need to trust her to work with her.
Damn it. I don't want to work with her, but I have no intention of abandoning the others to their fate. Fine. Looks like we all get to die together.
Come. I guess we should tell that vampyre that we're in.
Well Vanescula, it seems you have managed to convince us. Well done.
Thank you Veliaf. Now, shall we crack on?
What must we do?
If you want any hope of defeating my brother, you'll need the proper weaponry.
We have weaponry. We have the Ivandis Flail.
Indeed you do. Not a bad weapon by any means, but not ideal for taking on Lowerniel. He'll snap it in two before you even have a chance to use it.
It worked well enough on Ranis.
Lowerniel is far more powerful than Ranis was. If you want to defeat him, you should take my advice.
Fine. What are you proposing?
If I'm not mistaken, which I'm generally not, you made that weapon using research from the Haemalchemy Laboratory.
How did you know that?
, who was it that helped you find that laboratory?
Sarius Guile, your servant. Hang on... Did you send her?
Of course I did. Do you think she would have dared interact with you without my consent? Come now, surely you're smarter than that?
Anyway, I don't know much of the laboratory myself. It was Ranis that had it set up. Lowerniel wasn't very happy when he found out.
That said, I do suspect it might have more secrets for us to discover.
So you want us to go back there?
Yes. If you are able to find further research notes, I suspect we'll find a way to upgrade that weapon of yours.
Okay, I'd better be off to the laboratory then.
I would like to join you,.
Are you sure, Safalaan?
Yes. Better I be out there doing something than be stuck here brooding.
, do you remember how to reach the laboratory?
It's in sector six of Meiyerditch, just south east of the daeyalt mine.
Very well. I will meet you there.
Good luck to you both.
Keep an eye on Safalaan, won't you? I worry about how he's taking things.
I shall, fear not.
Good. Now you should head off to that laboratory. No point wasting time.
Be quick then.
What should I be doing?
You're meant to be searching the Haemalchemy Laboratory for more research. Run along now.
Right, I'd better get going.
Why do you hate your brother?
Why wouldn't I? He's an awful leader. My kind are slowly starving to death thanks to overpopulation, but he doesn't even seem to have noticed.
Is killing him not a bit much?

Not really. It is the vampyre way. There was once a time when things were far more savage. Back on our homeworld, new clan leaders were selected during a festival known as the Night of the Blood Moon.

It was a simple concept. A full night of killing. At dawn, the one with the most kills became the new leader. Lowerniel loved it. He won every time of course. Personally, I prefer our new way of life.
And yet you're still happy to kill him?
We are not the beasts we were back then, but some things do not change. Like I say, it is the vampyre way.
Now, did you want something else?
That's all, thanks.
How did Ranis capture Ascertes Hallow?
Do you know of Verzik Vitur?
Owner of the Theatre of Blood? Who doesn't know of her?
I'd give her the credit over Ranis. The two of them shared a love for playing with their food rather than eating it. They hatched all kinds of schemes together.
During the war, they managed to capture a justiciar, one of Efaritay's most elite warriors. They tortured him for days, until he gave them what they needed.
Which was?
A secret tunnel, leading directly into Efaritay's castle. The tunnel was here, in this very graveyard. Once they were inside, capturing Ascertes was easy.
In some ways, I think Lowerniel was a bit disappointed the fighting was over. The pair were still greatly rewarded, however. Verzik ended up getting Efaritay's castle. It was quite the boon for her.
Why did Lowerniel shut down the Haemalchemy Laboratory?
I can only assume he didn't like what they were doing there.
Well obviously. Could you be more specific though?
Are you familiar with their areas of research?
Ways to overcome blood shortages and ways to improve your immunity to our weapons.
Essentially. The first might seem to benefit Lowerniel, but when you look deeper you can see why he wasn't a fan.
For our kind to be less reliant on humans would be a fundamental change to our society. History has told us that leaders generally don't survive such a transition.
As for the second, I think it's obvious why Lowerniel wanted to put a stop to that. Just ask Ranis why that research maybe wasn't overly wise.
I see. I guess that makes sense.
Indeed. Of course, Lowerniel's long absences mean that a lot of research was already complete before the laboratory was shut down. Hence how you were able to use it against Ranis.
Which we were only able to do because of you. Why did you send Sarius to us?
A test. Even back then I knew that Lowerniel needed to go. I wanted to see if a partnership with the Myreque was worth exploring.
Actually, never mind.
Meet me at the laboratory, friend. Let's see what we can discover.
These are dark times friend.
They are. But maybe there's a light at the end of the tunnel.
Maybe. I guess we'll find out soon enough. Be careful out there.
And you.
We'll soon be doing battle with one of the most powerful beings in existence. How are you feeling?
I'm okay. How about you?
Surprisingly calm, to be honest. We may well die in this fight, but if we manage to defeat Drakan, it will be worth it.
I guess it's not a bad way to go.
Exactly.
Imagine, the death of Lowerniel Drakan. Think what that could do to these dark lands.
It's crazy to think it might actually happen.
We've come a long way. Just one final hurdle.
And then, peace in our time.
Let us hope, let us hope.
Hey. Looks like it's really happening. We're finally going to show Drakan what happens when you cross the Myreque.
Looks like it. How are you feeling?
Oh I'm great. I know we can do this, especially with you on our side.
I hope you're right to have faith in me.
Don't worry, I know you won't let us down.
Do you think we're ready for this?
The fight with Drakan? Yes, I think so. We killed Ranis after all.
Lowerniel's a much bigger fish though.
He is. But it's not just me this time. This time there's all of us. And Vanescula too, assuming she doesn't betray us.
Let us hope.
Good to see you,. Glad you made it here safely.
And you. How are you doing?
To be honest, I'm not sure if I've even properly taken it in yet. It's all so much. My mother, my sister... and of course, my father.
It feels strange. I feel like I should mourn, but how do I mourn a family I can't even remember?
And Vanstrom... My greatest enemy may well be my only remaining family. I wonder, is there anything left of Ascertes now? Is part of him still in there, buried away?
I don't know.
Probably best not thinking about, I suppose. My job is to lead the Myreque. I can't let anything else distract me from that, not even my family.
With all that's happened, I fear some of them may already be beginning to doubt me.
You have their support Safalaan, I know you do.
I hope so. I let them down with that Serafina business, and people died. I can't let them down again.
Anyway, let us crack on. It seems that we should be able to access more of the laboratory through the doors to the south.
They were damaged and couldn't be opened, but I think I've managed to fix them up.
I didn't know you had a knack for Construction?
Ah, one of my hidden talents. Of course, not much room for that sort of thing around here.
That's a shame. I'm sure you'd make a great builder.
Ha! It's strange to think how differently our lives could have been, is it not? Alas, here we are.
I'm sorry. Maybe now isn't the best time for these kinds of conversations.
You have a good sense of humour my friend, even in these dark times. Do not be ashamed of that. When things are darkest, a bit of light is very welcome.
I guess you're right.
Shall we get going then?
Indeed. Let's head in.
Look out!
I'll be back soon.
Well just let me know when you're ready to go in.
Shall we head in?
Let's go.
Not yet. I need to prepare first.
Well just let me know when you're ready.
Are you alright Safalaan?
I... I'm fine. What happened?
We were attacked by some bloodvelds. You used your powers to kill one.
Blasted powers! What good are powers when I have no control over them?
Don't be so harsh on yourself. Your powers have got us out of a couple of sticky situations now.
Yes, but what happens if I totally lose control? Will I lose my memory like that time with Vanstrom? Or will I do something even worse?
Well now that we know the source of your powers, maybe we can find a way to help you control them.
Maybe... Let us hope we can do so before it's too late.
Bah, look at me,. I'm meant to be a leader, but I can barely control my own body. I'm like an old man.
Well... you are the son of Queen Efaritay. I guess that makes you thousands of years old.
Eugh, what an awful thought. I guess I should get myself a walking stick.
I'm sure we can arrange that.
Let's add it to the list. First though, the research we came here for. I'm afraid I'm still feeling a bit weak, so you'll have to do the heavy lifting on this one.
Oh I see how it is! You find out you're an old-timer and now I have to do all the work!
Afraid so. My poor back simply can't take it. I've no doubt you'll manage though.
Okay. I'll have a look round and see what I can find. You stay here, old-timer.
Please stop calling me that.
I can make no promises.
Do you think we can kill Drakan?
To be honest, I don't know. They say he's the most powerful being in existence. The truth is though, we know pretty much nothing about him.
I guess the point is that we're in the best position possible. If we can't kill him, I suspect no one can.
We seem to be dealing with a lot of uncertainties.
Oh we are. But you play the hand you're dealt, my friend. This is our hand.
I guess. Losing a card game generally doesn't result in death though.
You should try playing against a werewolf.
What do you think of Vanescula?
I don't trust her. She feigned affection back at the graveyard. But I know she's just doing it for her own gain.
You still chose to work with her though.
Yes. She is our only hope of defeating her brother. In truth, I'd pretty much made my choice even before she told me about my family.
That's good to know. I worried you were being too hasty after you discovered the truth.
You are not wrong to worry, friend. I may well be leading us to certain death.
Well you have our support. For better or worse.
Thank you. I appreciate it, especially from you. As an outsider, you could easily turn and run at any time. The fact that you're still here speaks volumes.
Could we talk more about your family?
Not now.
I'm sorry. I know you must have so many questions. I have plenty myself. But I need to focus right now and cannot be distracted by such thoughts.
We will talk later. You have my word.
Alright there old-timer?
I'm starting to regret praising your humour.
What do I need to be doing?
You need to try and find some more haemalchemy research. There must be something of note around here.
Any luck?
Yes. I found some more haemalchemy research.
Good work. I'll look after it for you.
Sure. Here you go.
Right. We'd better get back to the graveyard. I'll meet you there.
Okay. I'll see you soon.
I'm going to keep hold of it.
Come now,. We need that research. Please give it to me as soon as you can.
We should get back to the graveyard. I'll meet you there.
Still here Ivan?
Yup. Most of the others went to the Meiyerditch hideout. But I wanted to stick around.
How come?
This graveyard is one of the last remaining examples of what Hallowvale was like. I bet there's a lot to discover here.
Maybe once Drakan is gone, we can get some proper archaeologists out here. I'm sure they could learn all sorts.
I bet they could. You holding up okay?
Oh yes. We're going to win this, I know it.
You seem very confident?
Why wouldn't I be? I have faith in Saradomin. I have faith in Safalaan and Veliaf. I have faith in you. Together, we will beat Drakan.
I do hope so.
Have faith, friend. Anyway, I'd best let you get on.
Take care Ivan.
...of your arrogance. What makes you so sure we won't also kill you once your brother is dead?
Oh, you could try. Although I doubt it would end well for you.
Now this is exactly what I mean.
Oh lighten up would you. No sense of humour at all.
I am no fool. I am all too aware of my own weaknesses and how you could exploit them. When we take on Lowerniel, I don't intend to be alone.
I have many supporters amongst the vampyres of Darkmeyer. Your small group against all of us? The fight would be brief.
Hiding behind larger numbers? Not very honourable.
Now you see, I've tried honour before. Decided it wasn't for me. Honour matters not if you're dead. I intend to keep living.
Ah, you're back. Good to see you made it okay.
Yes, yes. Wonderful to see you. Shall we get on with things?
Go ahead.
Well, the research you recovered has confirmed something I have long suspected.
Which is?
Queen Efaritay was a renowned botanist. She used this to her advantage many times during the war, breeding all kinds of plant life to use against us.
One of these plants was the Blisterwood tree. The icyene used the sap of this tree to create poisons that were deadly to vampyres.
However, I've always suspected the tree might have other uses. Clearly the researchers in the Haemalchemy Laboratory thought the same.
So what did they find out?
It seems that the bark of the Blisterwood tree can be used to create weapons that are deadly to my kind.
How?

Well I'm no scientist, oddly enough. But from what I can tell, even when chopped away, the wood of the tree is very much alive. It shifts and grows in unpredictable ways, rendering our immunities useless.
I see where we're going with this. You want us to use this tree to construct new weapons?
Well... not quite. While not perfect, the work you've already done has potential. I see no need to completely discard it.
Instead, I suggest we use wood from the Blisterwood tree to enhance the weapons you already have. When combined with the wood, I imagine that flail of yours will be quite effective.
Perfect for killing your brother. Assuming you don't kill us first.
Again with this? I've already told you, I have no need to kill you. Once Lowerniel is gone, I envisage a new age, where my kind and yours live in harmony. I need you alive for that.
I'll believe it when I see it.
That's fine by me.
We're getting sidetracked here. We need some wood from this Blisterwood tree. Where do we find it?
Ah... that's the tricky bit. I know only of one Blisterwood tree. It lies in Efaritay's old Arboretum, in the middle of Darkmeyer.
It's in the capital? We'll have no hope of getting in there.
I don't see why we'd need to. Vanescula here can get some of this wood for us.
Really now? Do you think I have any intention of touching a tree that can kill vampyres? No. You will need to recover the wood yourself.
How?
Darkmeyer isn't as impenetrable as you might think. I know of a way you can get in. But first, you'll need a disguise.

Now, luckily for us, my kind have some shapeshifting abilities. Many vampyres, such as myself, prefer to take on a human form. That means you should be able to fit in... with the right outfit of course.
Trader Sven sells vyrewatch disguises. We've used them in the past.
Not bad, but we'll want to make some adjustments. We need you looking less like a vyrewatch and more like a noble.
Polmafi knows how to use a needle. He should be able to sort us out.
Good idea., could you pick up a vyrewatch disguise from Trader Sven? He lives in sector one of Meiyerditch, directly south of Old Man Ral's house.
Will do. I'm guessing I should take it to Polmafi after that?
That's right. He and the others have gone back to the Meiyerditch hideout, in Old Man Ral's basement.
Once you have the disguise, we will need to scent it. We will discuss that once you have it.
Okay, I'll be back when I have the disguise.
You should get going friend. That disguise won't sort itself out.
Okay. I'll see you later.
Go and buy a vyrewatch disguise from Trader Sven. His house is the one directly south of Old Man Ral's, in sector one of Meiyerditch.
And once I have the disguise?
Deliver it to Polmafi at the Meiyerditch hideout, in Old Man Ral's basement.
Okay, I shall return later.
You're meant to be working with Polmafi to create a suitable disguise. Now, off you go.
I need to look like a vampyre noble. Safalaan suggested we use a vyrewatch disguise from Trader Sven as a starting point.
That's a good idea. Do you have a vyrewatch disguise with you?
Yes I do.
Great. Hand it over and I'll get to work.
Here you go.
Here's your finished disguise. Be careful out there.
There was enough material for some spares. I'll leave them in the chest in the corner in case you need more.
I'll keep it for now.
Well I can't make your new disguise until you give it to me.
Good to see you. How are things going?
Not too bad. We've managed to recover some more haemalchemy research. We think it can be used to further improve our weaponry.
Well that's good to hear. Anything I can help with?
Yes, actually. To make the improved weapons, I need to infiltrate the city of Darkmeyer. For that, I need a disguise. Veliaf said you'd be able to help.
The city of Darkmeyer? Oh my! You'd better be careful.
Anyhow, yes I should be able to help. What kind of disguise do you need?
Do you mind fetching one?
Sure. I'll see if I can get one from Trader Sven.
Hello there. Do you have a vyrewatch disguise yet?
I'll be here once you have.
Do you have the disguise?
Well we can't go any further then. Return once you have it.
I have it here.
Wonderful. Now, as mentioned earlier, we will need to scent this disguise. My kind have a keen sense of smell and will quickly notice an imposter if they don't smell right.
What do we need to scent it with?
Blood of course. The blood of a vyre.
So I kill a vyrewatch and use their blood to scent the disguise?
Oh... no, no, no. A vyrewatch will not do. We want you to blend in with the nobles. That means we need the blood of a noble.
There's a difference?
Of course. The lords and ladies of Darkmeyer won't go interacting with any old rabble.
Of course. Go on then, give us some of your blood.
Oh dear Veliaf, you misunderstand. The smell of my blood will be far too recognisable to work. We need someone a bit more obscure.
Ah yes, how silly of me to not realise. You clearly have a vampyre in mind. Spit it out.
I think we use this as an opportunity to deal with two issues in one. Damien Leucurte has become a problem that needs to be resolved. He is also a noble, albeit a lesser one.
So we kill Damien and use his blood. Sounds good to me.
Indeed. Let's get it done., meet me outside the church in Slepe. We're going to pay Damien a little visit.
If you want, you can use the boat to quickly get to Slepe. Should be faster than walking.
Good idea. Veliaf, I'll see you there.
Meet me outside the church in Slepe. We're going to pay Damien a little visit.
You should meet up with Veliaf in Slepe. We'll talk later.
Okay. Until then.
You need to kill Damien Leucurte and use his blood to scent your disguise. Run along now.
Well met friend. Didn't think we'd be back here so soon.
I know. Not a bad thing though. Damien needs to be dealt with.
I suppose you're right. Now, I've done some scouting. It seems Damien is hiding in the manor. Interestingly, he doesn't seem to have increased his security since Kroy's death.
He may well have tried, but I bet we scared off a lot of his supporters.
They don't want to mess with you my friend. I suspect you're becoming quite notorious amongst the vampyres.
Do you think we should be able to access the manor easily?
Looks like it. I think we can get in through the dungeon. Let me know when you're ready and we'll head on in.
Let's do this.
Oh wait! I forgot the disguise!
Well you'd better go and get it. I'll be here when you are ready.
Do you think Safalaan is doing okay?
You tell me. You've spent more time with him since his discovery.
He seems to be okay. At least, as okay as anyone could be in that situation. He seems to still be focused, and he's not lost his sense of humour.
Maintaining a good sense of humour is common coping mechanism when dealing with shock. I hope he's not just putting on a facade. If he's struggling, he should seek our support.
You're not wrong. But that's for him to decide. He knows we are there if he needs us.
It's good that he has people like you. I may have known him a long time, but I can't pretend to be any good at comforting people in such situations. I never manage to say the right thing.
And you think I do?
You can't be any worse than me. I'd take that as a victory.
Do you think things will improve for him?
I don't know. He may well soon come face to face with Lowerniel Drakan, the cause of all his pain. I hope he is ready for that.
And then there's Vanstrom, of course. Their paths are likely to cross again before all this is over. And when that happens, who knows what the outcome will be.
Anyway, are you ready to deal with Damien?
How are you feeling about working with Vanescula?
Well, she hasn't killed us yet, which I consider a win. It seems she spoke the truth about wanting her brother dead.
Of course, I still fully expect her to betray us once he's gone.
But you're still willing to go ahead with this?
I wouldn't say I'm 'willing' as such, but what other choice do I have? The others want to do it and I'll be damned if I'm just going to leave them to their fates.
That doesn't mean I haven't been considering contingencies, of course. I've asked Ivan to prepare us a teleport spell in case we need to make a hasty exit.
Seems sensible to me. Let's hope it doesn't come to that.
Indeed. But enough about Vanescula. Are you ready to deal with Damien?
I'll be back later.
Are you ready to deal with Damien?
So here you are. I knew it was only a matter of time before you lot showed up.
We'd hate to disappoint. It's over Damien.
Listen to your arrogance! Is this what we've become? I remember when we commanded respect. Your kind would cower in fear at the sight of us!
Once, yes. But now, we are not the ones cowering.
You think I'm afraid? I am a lord of Darkmeyer. I am fear!
A lord of Darkmeyer? Isn't a lord meant to have followers? Looks like yours have run away.
Cowards! That's what they are. I was their saviour! When our great leaders abandoned us, I was the one that kept them fed!
And now you're nothing.
Face it Damien, you're out of time. There's nowhere to run.
That is true for all of us!
Time to see what you're really made of!
Crombwick! You will support me!
What? But I can't...
You can and you will!
Come on then! This ends now!
Got what you need?
Looks like it.
Good. I don't want to stick around this place any longer than needed. I will meet you back at the graveyard.
What do you think this means for Slepe?
The death of Damien can't do any harm. That said, don't expect this to suddenly fix everything around here. The Sleeper Plague isn't the only illness in this town.
You mean their religion?
I do. The people here chose to follow Zamorak. A choice like that has consequences. Bad ones.
You think they are being punished?
Not exactly. I don't believe in fate myself. I'm sure someone like Drezel would say otherwise, though. I just think that if you play with fire, you're going to end up getting burnt.
So do you think the Sleeper Plague will go away now?
Well there shouldn't be any new cases now that Damien and Kroy are gone. That won't help those already infected though.
Maybe there's a cure.
Maybe. I suspect this town holds a lot of secrets... but now is not the time to explore them. We have other business to attend to.
I'll see you at the graveyard.
I'll see you there
No need for us to stick around this place any more. I will meet you back at the graveyard.
I sent some of Damien's blood to Polmafi. Speak to him if you need a replacement disguise.
Well well, the vampyre slayer returns. Two of my brothers, now Damien as well. Quite the body count you're amassing.
Two of your brothers?
Did you not know? here isn't just responsible for killing Ranis. He also killed our younger brother, Draynor.
Count Draynor, he called himself. He wasn't much of a challenge compared to Ranis and Damien, truth be told.
Ah yes, the great 'Count' Draynor. He loved his stupid titles. He was weak even before he got trapped on the wrong side of the Salve. A coward as well.
There's a reason Lowerniel had him banished. I'm just surprised he lasted as long as he did.
Now, I assume you have a finished disguise?
I do.
Wonderful. Now we're getting somewhere. With that disguise, you should be ready to enter Darkmeyer.
But how does he get into the city? The place is a fortress.
Almost, but not quite. I know of a small weakness in the southern wall. A crack, in sector six of Meiyerditch, just north of the daeyalt mine.
It should be big enough for you to squeeze through, as long as you haven't recently eaten an excess of cakes.
Seems suspiciously convenient. Why hasn't the crack been filled in?
My kind are struggling to feed themselves. They've currently got bigger worries than cracks in walls.
Besides, up until now, why would any human even consider entering Darkmeyer? Perhaps you hadn't noticed, my kind is not known for treating humans well.
Although you expect us to live in harmony once this is done. How are we meant to achieve that when each side hates the other?
I never said it would be easy. I don't expect us to kill my brother and then have a big party. It will be work, but given time, that work will pay off.
We'll see.
So that aside, I can use this crack to enter Darkmeyer? What then?
You'll need to get to Efaritay's Arboretum in the middle of the city. The city architects gave it facelift to help it blend in, but it's still impossible to miss.
Once inside, you'll need to chop some logs from the Blisterwood tree. We'll need enough to arm everyone, so eight logs in total.
Now, whatever happens, you must not let your true identity be exposed. If a member of the Myreque was found in Darkmeyer, the entire city would be locked down.
Any tips for blending in?
Well keep your disguise on for a start. You'll want a suitable name as well. Your current one isn't very fitting. If anyone asks, you're called.
. It suits you,.
, right. Anything else I should know?
I expect you to see many things you consider undesirable while in Darkmeyer, especially where your kind are concerned.
While you may be tempted to get involved, don't. Stay in character no matter what.
Okay, I'll be back once I have the logs. Wish me luck.
Good luck. Myreque prevail.
Myreque prevail.
You should get going friend. Darkmeyer awaits.
Good luck. Myreque prevail.
Be careful in Darkmeyer, friend. I can't even imagine how dangerous that city is.
Don't worry, I shall be.
You need to infiltrate Darkmeyer and recover eight logs from the Blisterwood tree. Now, off you go.
Hey there.
I'm not interested in making small talk.
Suit yourself.
What do you want?
To go in the Arboretum.
Well you can't.
Why not?
Because nobody can go in the Arboretum.
That can't be true. Someone must be allowed in?
Who are you?
. I'm new here.
Clearly. Well, you're wrong. No one can go in the Arboretum, by order of the Drakan family themselves.
Why do you want to go in, anyway?
Do you actually care?
No, but I have a job to do.
What will it take for you to let me in? There must be something you want. Do you want money?
I have no need for your money.
What then?
Eugh, fine! There's something I need doing. Get it done for me and I'll grant you access.
Great! What do you need?
There's a juvinate who was meant to deliver something to me. He hasn't shown up. Find him and tell him that Desmodus Lasiurus is getting impatient.
Sure thing! What's he meant to be delivering?
Some slaves. You heard of Gadderanks? He was some human that Vanstrom used to help collect blood tithes.
Well, he went and got himself killed by the Myreque. Vanstrom owed me a favour so he agreed to let me have his wife and child.
Oh... I see.
You got a problem?
No.
Good. Mordan Nikazsi is the juvinate you're looking for. He'll be somewhere in the lowest tier of the city. Now, get lost!
What are you doing?
Trying to enter the Arboretum.
Did you find Mordan Nikazsi?
Why are you here then? He'll be somewhere in the lowest tier of the city. Go find him!
I did.
And?
He sold your slaves to Alexei Jovkai.
That filthy wretch! I'll have him killed for this! Go find my slaves and bring them to me!
What do you want?
Are you Mordan Nikazsi?
Yes, what of it?
Desmodus Lasiurus sent me.
Oh great, just what I need.
He wants his slaves. When are you planning to deliver them?
I'm not. He shan't be getting his slaves.
Err... Why not?
Because I sold them to someone else.
What? Why?
Why? Because I'm starving that's why! You lords and ladies probably haven't noticed yet, but you will soon enough. It's only a matter of time before you all run out of blood as well!
So you sold them for blood? Did you not think Desmodus would notice?
If I didn't do something I'd have been dead anyway. Better a quick death at Desmodus' hands than a slow one due to starvation!
Look I don't care what happens between you and Desmodus, I just need to recover those slaves. Who did you sell them to?
Don't waste your time, you won't get them back.
Why?
