Because I sold them to Lord Alexei Jovkai, one of the most powerful vampyres in the city. He looks at you the same way you look at me. He'll never let you have them.
We'll see. Where can I find him?
He lives in the upper part of the city, but the slaves won't be there. He has a prison north of the Arboretum. That's where you'll find them.
Sounds like I need to visit this prison then.
Fine.
Why are you back again?
Remind me, where can I find Desmodus' slaves?
They're not his slaves. They belong to Alexei Jovkai now. He'll be keeping them in his prison north of the Arboretum.
Nothing.
Go away then.
Leave me alone. I have a job to do.
Hello.
Hello. Is your name Gadderanks?
Yes... I'm Maria Gadderanks. But... You're not one of Lord Jovkai's lot.
No I'm not. Are you doing okay?
I... I think so. We only arrived here a short while ago, but they've already given us food and some new clothes for Ron.
Wait... What?
You must be new around here. Lord Jovkai isn't like the rest of your lot. He keeps us well looked after.
He's taking care of you?
Oh yes. A nice bed, good food and clean clothes. All he asks in return is a bit of blood from time to time. Lovely guy.
I don't...
Hey you! What are you doing?
I was just talking to the... prisoners?
Well clear off! These are Lord Jovkai's personal tithes.
But...
What's all this noise? What's going on in here?
It's this vyre, my lord. They're here to cause trouble.
You! Who are you?
I'm. And I'm not here to cause any trouble, thank you very much.
I will be the judge of that,. Now, why are you here?
These prisoners of yours, they were promised to Desmodus Lasiurus.
Who?
He's a guard at the Arboretum.
Ah, so he's a nobody. Well, these prisoners are mine, I paid for them. You'll have to tell him to find some different ones.
Yes... It seems nice here. We'd like to stay.
Jovkai! What's going on here?
Nothing for you to concern yourself with Vanstrom. I have this under control.
It doesn't seem that way.
Tell me, is it now protocol for the head of the vyrewatch to come and investigate every disturbance?
Surely you have bigger problems, like the blood shortages amongst the commoners?
As it so happens I was on my way to the lower city to look into that very issue. However, on my way past, I heard shouting.
And you decided to investigate? How convenient. Tell me, is Lord Drakan really so interested in my business that he's now having you spy on me?
You're paranoid, Jovkai. Lord Drakan doesn't care about you.
No. Many are starting to wonder if he cares about any of us.
Careful there, Jovkai. Now tell me, what's happening here?
This vyre was trying to steal some of my prisoners. I was having them removed.
Hang on... I know those humans. That's the Gadderanks family. They don't belong to you.
What do you mean? I paid for them!
That doesn't make them yours. These prisoners belong to Desmodus Lasiurus. You will have them returned to him at once.
Or what? You don't get to order me around!
You may be a lord, but you still answer to the Drakan family. That means you also answer to me.
And what do you think Lasiurus will do with them if I give them to him? They're safe here. They'll be looked after.
I do not care what Lasiurus does with them any more than I care about you and your weird tendencies.
Now, we're done here. See that the prisoners are returned, or I'll have this place shut down.
You there, vyre!
Ye... Yes?
You will return to Lasiurus and tell him that his prisoners are on their way.
Okay.
Good.
Wait... Your voice, vyre. It sounds... familiar.
What is your name?
Clearly. Which makes me wonder why I'd know your voice.
Turn and face me. I want to get a good look at you.
What?
Turn, and face me. I will not ask again.
Vanstrom!
Eugh, what now Guile?
Forgive me for the interruption, but Lady Vanescula has urgent need of you.
Fine. My business here is done, regardless.
I thought we might do okay here but I guess we have another new owner now.
Why are you still here? Go tell Lasiurus that his slaves will be with him soon.
Have you sorted my slaves out?
It's all dealt with. They'll be with you soon.
Good. Maybe you're not as useless as you look.
I can go in the Arboretum now, then?
Yes. Just don't tell anyone I let you in.
Can I go in the Arboretum?
Yes. Now leave me alone.
What do you want?
I want to access my bank account.
No.
No?
Newcomers aren't allowed to use the bank. Come back once you've earned our trust.
I don't have time to poke around down there. I have work to do.
Now's not the time for searching through corpses. I have work to do.
What are you selling?
To you? Nothing.
You're new here. I don't sell to new blood. Make a name for yourself and maybe I'll reconsider.
You're back. Do you have the logs?
Well run along then. We need eight logs from the blisterwood tree.
Yes, I have them here.
Good work. Did it all go okay?
It was a bit close at times. But I managed it.
A bit close? You nearly blew everything with your little run in with Vanstrom. It was a good job I had Sarius keep an eye on you.
Spying on me?
I just wasn't convinced you'd be able to do the job. It seems I was right to be cautious.
I had it under control. By the way, where is Safalaan?
He said he needed a walk. I told him not to, but he insisted he'd be fine.
You worry too much. Safalaan is a big boy.
Now,. Time to get these weapons made.
What do I need to do?
I've given your friend Vertida the required information. He will show you what to do.
He's at the Meiyerditch hideout. Make sure to take the logs with you. The others need them for their own weapons.
Right then. I'll be back once the weapons are made.
Deliver those blisterwood logs to Vertida in the Meiyerditch hideout. He'll show you how to make the new weapons out of them.
Right, I'll be back later.
You're meant to be working with Vertida to make the blisterwood weaponry. Run along now.
I hear you're meant to be bringing us some logs. Do you have them?
I'll be here once you have them. We need eight in total.
Great. Could I have seven of them?
Right, we're going to be using these logs to make blisterwood sickles. That's what most of us will be using in the battle.
However, I think you'll be able to swap out the sickle on your flail for a blisterwood one.
A blisterwood flail. I like the sound of that. So how do we make these sickles?
It should be very similar to how you made your emerald sickle. First, you'll want a blessed silver sickle. We have plenty in the crate over there.
You'll want to take your blessed sickle and use a chisel to embed a ruby in it. You'll need to get your own ruby I'm afraid.
Once that's done, you'll need to enchant the ruby sickle using a ruby enchant spell.
Finally, you'll need to use a knife to combine your sickle with the blisterwood logs. That will give you a blisterwood sickle.
And then I can attach that to my flail?
Exactly. If you need any help, just let me know.
I'll get started.
I'll keep them for now.
Well let me know when you're ready to hand them over.
How's it going?
What do I need to do again?
First you'll want to take a blessed silver sickle and use a chisel to embed a ruby in it. There's some blessed sickles in a crate here but you'll need to get your own ruby.
Finally, you'll need to use a knife to combine your sickle with the blisterwood logs. That will give you a blisterwood sickle that you can attach to your flail.
Great. I'll get going.
Good, thanks.
Well met,. Do you have your weapon?
Well off you go then. You'll need it before we go any further.
Well met,. I'm guessing you have your weapon?
That's right. I'm prepared.
And you took the logs to the others?
I did indeed.
Then we are ready.
Safalaan isn't back yet.
Do you know where he went?
There's a path just north of the graveyard. He went for a walk in that direction.
I'll see if I can find him.
Don't take too long.
You need to try and find Safalaan. He went for a walk just north of the graveyard.
Okay, I'll be back once I've found him.
You're meant to be finding Safalaan. Off you go.
Safalaan.
So this is it. All these years of fighting. All these years of running. It all ends today. One way or another.
One way or another.
You seem troubled?
I guess that makes two of us.
Ha! Well, I asked first.
Do you remember Gadderanks?
The human that worked with Vanstrom? Didn't you and Veliaf kill him?
We did. Before he died though, he helped us. In return, he asked us to help his family.
I found them, in Darkmeyer. They were in a prison, albeit a nice one. The vampyre that owned it looked after his tithes.
They're not there anymore though, thanks to me. Another vampyre has them now. One that I don't imagine will show any kindness to them.
I assume you had no choice?
Yes. It was the only way for me to get into the Arboretum. That doesn't change what I did, though. I broke my promise to a dying man.
A man that worked for the vampyres.
Because he had no other choice. Vanstrom would have killed his family otherwise.
We make the hard choices to spare others from having to.
Yes. But this time we weren't the ones who paid for it.
When Drakan is gone, and Morytania is free, it will all be worth it.
If Vanescula keeps her word.
Indeed.
Well, that's me. Your turn.
It's possible we will encounter Vanstrom today.
And I wonder... is there anything left of the man he once was?
Does the process of vampyrification destroy everything that makes us human? Or does it just hide it?
Maybe we'll never know. And yet...
Our whole order was built upon hope. A hope so small, it might as well have not even existed. But that never stopped us.
I still cling on to some hope for him. Is that wrong?
It's rarely wrong to hope.
Well... We could stand here forever, watching the world go by. It's just delaying the inevitable.
Time to end it.
Oh... One last thing,.
Thank you, for everything. It's been a pleasure.
Come. Let us return to the others.
Well it looks like everything is ready.
Yes. Everyone has one of the new blisterwood sickles. They are all prepared.
Good. Here's what's going to happen.
From here, I will teleport our group to the Darkmeyer Arboretum. There, we will join with some vyres loyal to me.
We will take your group to Castle Drakan as our prisoners. Once inside, my vyres will ensure no one enters while we deal with my brother.
And then?
Once Lowerniel is dead, I will teleport you all back here again. I will then announce his death to my kind and take his place as the ruler of Morytania.
From there, we will start to build our new kingdom, together.
Yes we will.
Make sure you're ready for this,. Once we start, there's no going back.
Good, good. Once you are ready, let me know and we will begin.
This is it. This is the day we've spent so long fighting for. Myreque prevail.
Myreque prevail.
I need more time to prepare.
Well don't take too long. Return once you are ready.
Are you ready to deal with my brother?
So this is it. End of the line. Good luck. I'll see you on the other side.
Good luck Ivan. Myreque prevail.
Vanescula? What's going on here?
Vanstrom. I am here with a gift for my brother.
But... that's the Myreque.
Yes. All the Myreque.
I don't understand. How?
Your efforts were valiant, Vanstrom. But alas, they were unsuccessful. I decided to take matters into my own hands, using a new tactic.
I negotiated with them. Convinced them that I was on their side. After that, bringing them in was trivial.
I... I'm sorry my lady, but this just seems too good to be true.
Well it is true. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'd best be getting inside.
But...
I rememeber when I was young. Our father would take me out into the woods, hunting.
That was where I truly discovered what it meant to be alive.
The constant fear. That knowledge that if you fail, your very life may well be over.
But then at the same time, the thrill. The thrill of the chase. Of the conquest. Nothing can match it.
One day, he decided to bring my sister along. He felt it was time for her to develop her own taste for the hunt.
She was a natural. A raw talent I had never seen before, and rarely since. I felt a unique pride that day.
That wasn't all, of course. There were so many things she excelled at. So many talents.
But lying, Vanescula?
Lying was never one of them.
Brother. I don't...
Tell me, Vanescula. What is the cause of this latest betrayal? How is it I have displeased you this time?
I don't know what...
Vanescula, please. This veil of lies is thinner than the humans you feast upon.
Now, the truth.
Alright.
You have been gone too long, brother. While you spend your days hidden away, lamenting about that stupid rock, our kind suffer.
Out there, in your city, they're starving. There's not enough blood to go around and their great leader is unwilling to provide a solution.
Something has to change, or we're doomed.
Vanescula, my dear sister. You disappoint me.
You and your kind, you have spent your years engrossing yourself in culture, in aristocracy. Pretending to be something you're not.
And in that time, you have forgotten something.
Allow me to remind you.
I am Lowerniel Vergidiyad Drakan, ruler of Morytania and the lord of Vampyrium.
And when you play your games of politics, you do not do so because you're smarter than me.
When you weave your words and make your schemes, you are not getting the better of me.
No. You do these things only because I allow it. Because your plots are so insignificant to me, that I do not even care to pay attention to them.
But now Vanescula, now you have my attention. And now, you will be reminded what it means to cross the lord of Vampyrium.
No!
Let's get him!
For Andiess!
No! Wait!
Kael! Vertida!
Vanstrom.
My... my lord?
Are you still loyal?
Yes, my lord.
Good. Deal with the rest of this. My sister and I have much to discuss.
I've waited a long time for this day. The day that the Myreque finally die.
There'll be no hellhounds or abominations this time though. This time...
...I'll deal with you myself.
Wait!
Safalaan don't!
Well, well. Safalaan Hallow.
How long I have wished to end your pitiful life...
Stop! Just stop for a moment and think. This isn't who you really are!
You had a life before all of this. A life as Ascertes Hallow, my father.
Please! Think back to those days. Think back to who you used to be.
You talk too much.
Shall we begin?
We need to get back to Darkmeyer.
Well be quick about it.
But I've lost my flail.
Luckily for you, I had another made. Although I'll have to charge you for it.
How much?
40,000 coins.
I don't have that much.
I'll be here when you do.
Here you go. Now, are you ready?
That's a bit too much for me. I guess I'll make myself another one instead.
I've managed to retrieve some of your things. I imagine you'll want them back.
I don't have anything for you friend. If I did have any of your items, but you died before collecting them, they'll now be lost.
Enough! Stop this!
Stop? And why would I want to do that?
Father, please. You must remember something? Anything!
Remember? I remember everything!
I remember how weak Ascertes was! The pathetic love he had for his wife, for his children!
I remember how good it felt! To be uplifted! To be made something more!
No!
And I remember the joy when I took your sister's skull and crushed it with my bare hands!
No! No! No!
Safalaan!
Veliaf...
! Safalaan! We need to go!
Safalaan?
What... What have I done?
Ivan, teleport him out of there!
I can't! He's too far away!
Safalaan please.
What have I done?
Damn you Safalaan! Damn you!
, get over here! We need to go. Now!
He... He killed them. All of them.
Veliaf, what do we do?
Veliaf?
What do we do? There's nothing we can do. Don't you see, Ivan? It's over. They've won.
But we can't give up. We're the Myreque!
The Myreque are dead.
He's gone. They've all gone.
I'm sorry,. I need some time alone.
Are you sure? I could take you back to Paterdomus.
No. I'm staying here.
Take this. It's not much, but it's all I can offer.
Now, please. I'd like to be alone.
. I have a tome here that I think belongs to you.
Thank you, Ivan.

characters.name: Banker
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, professional and detached tone, a bank employee who serves customers with formal efficiency.

characters.name: Carl
characters.description: Adult male vampyre, Eastern European accent, suspicious and evasive tone, a barkeep secretly serving drugged drinks under orders from his vampyre masters.

characters.name: Damien Leucurte
characters.description: Ancient male vampyre, Eastern European accent, cruel and calculating tone, a lesser noble with sharp fangs and an unsettling stare who orchestrated the Sleeper Plague.

characters.name: Desmodus Lasiurus
characters.description: Adult male vampyre, Eastern European accent, disgruntled and authoritative tone, a guard who dislikes his job but possesses enough standing to claim slaves.

characters.name: Drezel
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, gentle and devout tone, a holy monk who guards the temple at Paterdomus and aids those fighting the darkness of Morytania.

characters.name: Hameln the Jester
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, whimsical yet caring tone, a traveling jester from the west who tends to his plague-stricken companion with surprising compassion.

characters.name: Ivan Strom
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, earnest and devout tone, an aspiring priest who joined the resistance after vampyres killed his parents.

characters.name: Kael Forshaw
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, determined and vigilant tone, a fighter for the Myreque who guards the resistance hideout in Meiyerditch.

characters.name: Kroy
characters.description: Adult male vampyre, Eastern European accent, cold and scientific tone, a worn alchemist who created the Elixir of Everlasting without moral constraint.

characters.name: Lord Alexei Jovkai
characters.description: Ancient male vampyre, Eastern European accent, surprisingly gentle tone, a noble who treats his human captives with unusual kindness and tenderness.

characters.name: Lord Crombwick
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, fearful and submissive tone, a weak-willed nobleman who has been broken and dominated by a vampyre lord.

characters.name: Lowerniel Drakan
characters.description: Ancient male vampyre, deep Eastern European accent, imperious and volatile tone, the ruthless dictator of Morytania who values the hunt above all else.

characters.name: Maria Gadderanks
characters.description: Adult female, British accent, frightened and desperate tone, a widow imprisoned alongside her son after her husband's death left them unprotected.

characters.name: Mordan Nikazsi
characters.description: Adult male vampyre, Eastern European accent, pragmatic and self-serving tone, a low-ranking juvinate willing to bend rules for his own survival.

characters.name: Polmafi Ferdygris
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, thoughtful and measured scholarly tone, an intellectual advisor who looks more like a librarian than a fighter.

characters.name: Prisoner
characters.description: Adult, British accent, weak and hopeless tone, a captive human drained of hope after prolonged imprisonment by vampyres.

characters.name: Radigad Ponfit
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, quick-tempered and vengeful tone, an agile mercenary fighter from Asgarnia who burns with hatred for vampyres.

characters.name: Safalaan Hallow
characters.description: Adult male half-Icyene, British accent, charismatic and determined tone, a tall mysterious leader of the Myreque with hidden powers he doesn't fully understand.

characters.name: Sarius Guile
characters.description: Adult female, British accent, quiet and calculating tone, a humble servant of Vanescula who is more capable and important than she appears.

characters.name: Vampyre Juvinate
characters.description: Adult vampyre, Eastern European accent, hungry and aggressive tone, a transformed human who retains some intelligence but is driven by predatory instincts.

characters.name: Vanescula Drakan
characters.description: Ancient female vampyre, Eastern European accent, intelligent and manipulative tone, an ambitious noble who plots against her own brother for power.

characters.name: Vanstrom Klause
characters.description: Ancient male vampyre, Eastern European accent, sinister and menacing tone, a ruthless murderer who delights in terrorizing the resistance and hunting humans.

characters.name: Veliaf Hurtz
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, bold and commanding tone, a devout Saradominist and resourceful leader of the Myreque resistance dedicated to defeating vampyres.

characters.name: Vendor
characters.description: Adult, British accent, weary merchant tone, a trader trying to make a living in the oppressed lands of Morytania.

characters.name: Vertida Sefalatis
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, quiet and war-weary tone, a skilled ranger who serves as second-in-command of the Sanguinesti Myreque with keen tactical awareness.

characters.name: Vyrewatch
characters.description: Adult vampyre, Eastern European accent, cold and demanding tone, a flying enforcer who patrols Meiyerditch collecting blood tithes from terrified citizens.

characters.name: Werewolf
characters.description: Adult, deep growling voice with Eastern European undertones, feral and aggressive tone, a savage shapeshifter loyal to the vampyre lords of Morytania.
